Heya,
> I finished laying (or is it lying?)

placing, or laying down (half right :))

> all the teleporters in my
> new scenario scenario.  I was giving them names, so I could tell them
> apart (That's a hint: there are more teleporters in this scenario than
> any other I have created).  I decided, for fun, to try out the
> scenario converter on the file and I learned something: The last
> object to be placed on the map is the first object listed in the file
> unless the converter flip-flops the order.

Interesting, the converter won't flip the order of objects, it works on FIFO
basis - reads in object from file, puts it at end of object list (so first
object is on top, last object is on the bottom) and then when it writes back
out it starts from the top of the list, so you should get the exact same
order.
The actual editor probably just places newly created objects at the top of
the list (an alternative is the bottom) for speed reasons - insert at
front/back of lists and most other sequential strucutres is constant whereas
insertion into the middle may not be.

> To get the teleporters to
> work in the order I wanted them to go, I had to place themn in reverse
> order, but the map file shows them in the correct order.

I'm not quite sure if that means the converter is not working right :)
I take it the map file is whats open in the editor?
*Looks confused*

> That brings me to another feature for the new scenario editor: ability
> to take a set of teleporters and change the order in which they would
> work.

That sounds useful, especially for long chains, and it shouldn't be very
hard to do either.
I've added it to the editor file and I'll clean it up and upload it to the
groups downloads area so others can see it.

- Deathifier
